rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Great lecturer and an incredible woman! Her classes are engaging and relevant. However, she is spread too thin. She doesn't have time to invest in her students outside of class or to grade assignments in a timely manner. Two-page papers not graded for 30-45 days. Reading sometimes not posted until 10:00pm night before.
I would highly recommend this class- Amy Cooke is a great lecturer and the content is extremely interesting and relevant.

Great professor. Lots of readings, but since water is my life, I loved the material we learned in the class. She's a very interesting professor and reflects passion for what she teaches. Would take another class with her! Exams can be a little ambiguous sometimes. Sometimes 3 reaaaaaaaaalllllyyyyy long readings for one night.
Dr. Cooke is very involved in what she teaches and is a great lecturer. I looked forward to going to her class. She was engaging and all of the homework was reading articles.
I love Amy Cooke! She takes a personal interest in all of her students and makes time to get to know them. She's the reason I chose to pursue environmental science. She knows her stuff, too.
